MyList.title: Choose the right class
paragraph: 1- hoose the right class: The class you select will determine your character's abilities, skills, and playstyle. Consider your preferred playstyle, such as melee combat, spellcasting, or ranged attacks, and choose a class that aligns with it.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fluxappsltd/Baldurs/main/3.1.png

2- Consider your race: Each race in Baldur's Gate 3 has unique racial abilities and attributes. Think about how these racial traits will complement your chosen class and playstyle. For example, if you want to play a spellcaster, choosing a race with a bonus to intelligence or charisma can be beneficial.

3- Allocate ability scores wisely: During character creation, you'll have the opportunity to assign ability scores to your character's attributes like strength, dexterity, and intelligence. Consider the requirements of your chosen class and prioritize the attributes that will enhance your character's abilities.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fluxappsltd/Baldurs/main/3.2.png

4- Choose a suitable background: Your character's background provides additional skills, proficiencies, and role-playing opportunities. Think about the story and personality of your character and select a background that aligns with it. This can add depth and flavor to your gameplay experience.

MyList.title: Dragonborn
paragraph: 1- Pros: Dragonborn have a breath weapon ability that can deal damage in a cone, making them effective in close combat. They also have resistance to a specific type of damage.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fluxappsltd/Baldurs/main/4.2.png
2- Cons: Dragonborn do not have any subraces, limiting their customization options compared to other races.

3- Barbarian: 

 Dragonborn, Half-Orc, Githyanki 
 Bard: Tiefling, Half-Elf, Drow 
 Cleric: Wood Elf, Hill Dwarf, Half-Elf  
 Druid: Gold Dwarf, Wood Elf, Half-Elf 
 Fighter: Dragonborn, Half-Elf, Dwarf 
 Monk: Human, Half-Elf, Githyanki 
 Paladin: Dragonborn, Half-Elf, Tiefling 
 Ranger: Drow, Wood Elf, Half-Elf 
 Rogue: Halfling, Human, Tiefling 
 Sorcerer: Tiefling, Half-Elf, Human 
 Wizard: Githyanki, High Elf, Tiefling.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fluxappsltd/Baldurs/main/4.3.png

4- It's important to note that these combinations are not the only viable options, and the effectiveness of a race and class combination can vary depending on playstyle and personal preference. Additionally, some races have subraces that can further enhance certain class abilities. Experimentation and finding a combination that suits your desired playstyle and character concept is key.
